website_summaries.verdict: Play food never goes out of style, and this one has foods from all four food groups. An excellent addition to a play kitchen or cooking with mom and dad.
pros: Foods are easy to recognize, even for toddlers
Provides hours of open-ended, imaginative play
Wooden bins help keep food organized
cons: Hard enough to hurt if thrown
It's best to stick to product's age recommendation

customer_reviews.title: The paint will chip!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really surprised this has such highly rated reviews. This just isn't safe for children. I'm super disappointed in the quality and the fact that the paint chips off so easily. I actually returned two of these thinking the first time it was just defective since the paint was chipped before we even opened the packaging but unfortunately the second set had the same problem. My toddler was actually interested in the chipping paint and was trying to scratch at the missing spots and making it worse. I hate plastic toys but it looks like that might be the safest option. I don't recommend this set at all.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Paint Peeling Off
customer_reviews.text: Received this set today and immediately gave it to my excited toddler. However, after a few minutes his hands were covered in paint chips. Puzzled I inspected the food and found the paint on the milk was peeling off. I'm sure this is a fluke but I would just expect better quality control from Melissa and Doug. Paint chips and toddlers don't mix. He is already too attached to the rest of the pieces so returning it is not an option, but sadly I had to take away the milk. I would have contacted the seller but that option is not available.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and I do not recommend purchasing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set for Christmas to go on the shelves of the Hape market. The burger cracked during the first week and paint is chipping off most pieces. The bread slices fit through the basket slots so they constantly fall out. Poor quality and I do not recommend purchasing. Buy plan toys or hape their pieces are better quality.
customer_reviews.author: VJ08

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I attached a photo of a play kitchen that I got for my son. I bought these wooden food group crates for him to play with in the kitchen. They are exactly what I wanted. The crates fit perfectly in the shelves of the kitchen which is a bonus, and the wooden foods don’t get damaged like the plastic ones do. My son has been playing with these foods for about 2 months now and they are doing very well holding up with an 18 month old. There are some spots on the edges where the paint has come off a little but besides that we haven’t had any problems. I would definitely recommend these
customer_reviews.author: Sadie Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed there isn't many pieces to the item it isn'teverything seen in the photo it's only 1
customer_reviews.text: Not as much as it looks it's one of the four you see in the photo not all of them I'm disappointed as I thought it would be all food seen in picture which it is not it's only one of the four squares that you see in the picture .... although melissa and Doug is an amazing Brand they are expensive and with that said I'm unhappy bc my son loves to play pretend food and cook and everything and now I am basically back at square one bc now I have to go out and buy more food bc clearly this isn't enough for him to play for more than 5 mins
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I loved melissa and doug products and have bought so many of them for my toddler. However I will not be buying anymore. My previous purchase was pound-a-peg toy and was so badly made but i gave it another chance thinking i probably recieved a bad piece, but ince again i feel let down. This wooden fruits and veggies set is so terribly made. The crates came broken. The ones that were not broken break upon merely touching it. The fruits and veggies are also poorly made.Never buying this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Skip
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. I don’t understand why Melissa and Doug gets such rave reviews and positive feedback. We’ve owned this product for like... maybe 2 weeks now and two of the pieces have already cracked/wood has split. We own the cleaning set too and that also fell apart within days of owning it. My daughter is in 1% for her height and weight and I’m pretty sure she could break something if she tried.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: We love everything Melissa and Doug, but this particular set is a total flop. The food items are so so tiny. I actually laughed at how small all four crates are, when I opened the box. Like, this is the orange for instance; it’s just an orange wooden ball. There’s no detail or anything and it’s cracked. We got the Melissa and Doug grocery check out counter and a few different food sets. This one is by far the less exciting of them. I’d return it and get a different set, of it wasn’t already opened for Christmas. We don’t hate it, it’s just not our favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Missing Vegetables
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product a little less than a year ago for my daughter’s 2nd birthday. She ended up getting so many presents I kept this one in the package and didn’t give it to her until Christmas. When she opened it, I noticed that we received two dairy crates and no vegetables. It’s obviously way past the return window, so we will be keeping this set. I’m disappointed, especially since the price point on the product is about 35% less now than when I purchased it. Otherwise, the quality is good and she’s enjoying playing with these.
customer_reviews.author: HechoEnColorado

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: I was in search of reasonably priced wooden food toys and I happened upon these. I really hate seeing my precious baby put plastic into her mouth and these are far cuter anyhow! She loves playing with these and so far no paint chips or anything of concern. I will say that the baskets are far smaller than I had imagined, but honestly I think they make way more sense at this size. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: My daughter prefers that I buy Melissa and Doug toys, which I think are a little pricey. In this instance, though, the toy is worth the price. I had also purchased some other food products from another manufacturer. Some of the items were plastic, which was fine, but there were also cartons of milk, boxes of cereal, etc. You can imagine what those paper cartons and boxes looked like after ten minutes of play with my 22-month-old granddaughter. They were crushed, crumpled, and in one case, torn. So, in this case, I’m glad I paid the money for a durable toy that will last, no matter how rough the play.
customer_reviews.author: sheila

customer_reviews.title: Not very realistic
customer_reviews.text: For the (relatively) high price I was expecting something more. These may be high quality in terms of durability (we've only had them for a few weeks but so far so good) but they're not very realistic. The chicken leg looks like a bottle of some sort, the orange is just a round orange ball, the fish kind of looks like a small bar of soap etc. The sizing is also weirdly inconsistent, with some things being close to lifesize and others being extremely miniature (for example, the hamburger patty is larger than the steak). It's ok, but I expected more for the price, and my toddler doesn't even recognize half the items as the food they're supposed to be.
customer_reviews.author: ahm

customer_reviews.title: The included baskets are great for not only organization but learning food groups
customer_reviews.text: This is such a cute little set. Very durable other than the fact that the paint is rubbing off on every piece after five months of mild use. The included baskets are great for not only organization but learning food groups. They are the perfect size for kids not tiny but not giant. I love that they are all wooden and not cheap plastic put together with smelly glue. They are very smooth and have been sanded and painted nicely. This will be a toy that lasts through multiple kids despite the paint rubbing off.
customer_reviews.author: John and Jody MullinsTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Durable play food that works in a play kitchen or even for outdoor play
customer_reviews.text: I love this play food. I bought the wooden Melissa & Doug play food first and it is wonderful but it was for outdoor play in our grandkid’s club house. I discovered that did not hold up to rain. We took that inside to the play kitchen and this plastic is perfect - realistic, durable, fun and made a great gift for my grandkids. I love the menu. I order food and the kids prepare my “take out”. So much fun for them.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Wooden, no plastic issues to worry about
customer_reviews.text: I saw a lot of reviews that the plastic food items had issues of being crushed, breaking, and even getting mold. These are solid wood, painted really well, and are great for playing in our child's little kitchen. The four little trays that come with them are also made of glued wood. I think I may throw them out, last night I stepped on one and it broke. Not a design flaw, I'm a big dude, just hurt a bit and made a sharp object. I do not think my almost two year old could come anywhere near breaking anything in this package. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L

customer_reviews.title: Nice assortment, but heavy
customer_reviews.text: These pretend food products are made of wood which is good for sturdiness and somewhat nostalgic, but my sweet 2-yr-old grdghtr regards the round items as "balls" and occasionally throws them, which is not good for many reasons. I can teach her not to do this, but even dropping some of the heavier items on a ceramic tile floor (my kitchen) could possibly cause tiles to have hairline cracks. Otherwise, it's a generous and colorful assortment. Also did not realize the 4 boxes are wood as well. Did not have a use for them in her current play--1 or more large plastic jars with lids or her FP shoppind cart are better for storage. Love the quality of Melissa&Doug toys.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: paint chipped!
customer_reviews.text: So, because its Melissa and Doug, i thought this would be best option for wooden food for my daughter's toy kitchen as usually, their products are good quality. However, literally, 10 minutes after she started playing with it, the paint on the "milk" piece chipped off! not exaggerating...literally, gave her the toy, she played for 10 minutes and it was chipping. This was not throwing it around, knocking it on the floor playing either. This was just handling it normally play. Very disappointed as i read reviews and see this is a common complaint with this item and it has yet to be corrected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend these !!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson got a Step 2 kitchen set for For Christmas. There was no fruit or vegetables with it so I purchase this out and I’m so happy I did. He’s already spent hours playing with the wooden fruit, vegetables,dairy and meat. He makes a mean hamburger LOL so happy I purchased this would highly recommend it the quality is excellent. The wooden crates that each product comes in make great storage when he’s not playing with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My kids enjoy them
customer_reviews.text: I like this set, and my kids like it too. I’ve had it for a couple months now. I notice some of the pieces the paint is coming off but that where my one year old was chewing on it, so not completely unexpected. I will say I was a little annoyed the one of the bars on the basket was broke before it even arrived. But other than that the set is really nice. *side note.. the egg I received is a half an egg not the whole one pictured, and some of the colors are different, but still in good taste so it doesn’t bother me.
customer_reviews.author: Naydana

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the best little kitchen sets I have bought!
customer_reviews.text: The little food items were made of all wood and the little carts are amazing to fit in the little kitchen fidges. My daughters love playing with them and I don't have to worry about broken box cartoons made of paper, plastic foods, that won't pop back in place. The kids love them because they have vibrant colors, look real and really make them feel like they have real food. Great little items.
customer_reviews.author: Love2read

customer_reviews.title: Nice amount, but paint gets off too easily
customer_reviews.text: Of course my kids bite these wood food every single time. I do not expect the wood to resist their tiny and sharp teeth, but what I am not happy about is that the paint goes away almost immediately, which raises two questions: one, is it safe for my kids to swallow the paint and, two, how long will they last? Some, like the fish and the cheese, already look terrible. Not very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Only for them for the crates
customer_reviews.text: Only got them for the crates honestly. I don't like that on the milk box there is a cow. It can just say MILK without the cow. There's other milk you know?! Oat milk, almond etc. I removed the fish and placed it with other toys as to recognize that it's a fish, and not for eating. The meat crate can be worked as tofu meat etc when explaining the different items.
customer_reviews.author: A. A

customer_reviews.title: Oh how much fun learning can be!
customer_reviews.text: Melissa & Doug Toys are the best toys you can get and only the best for my Grandchildren. Sure wish, we had the money for these toys, when their parents where little. I am confident, that they would still be around today and are ready for the great grandchildren. These food group once are especially good learning toys. The colors are bright and I had to buy two sets from the beginnin.
customer_reviews.author: Omami

customer_reviews.title: Had them for about a year
customer_reviews.text: Got these to go with my daughter's kitchen after wasting money on 4-5 plastic sets. No matter how hard I watched out either her, or my stubborn dachshund would chew the crap out of the plastic sets. I finally decided to try this, it was definitely worth the few extra dollars. My dog is uninterested in this wooden set, and they're tough enough to hold up against my destructive toddler. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Megan P.

customer_reviews.title: Durable toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my grandchildren. The first set went to my granddaughters(age 2 &4) they have had them over a year and look brand new. The second set I bought for my grandson age 4. They are perfect for playing store or cooking. The set looks larger in the picture than what they are, but they are still a nice gift.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Szabo

customer_reviews.title: Such a bad quality!
customer_reviews.text: I love Melissa&Doug for their great quality toys, my toddler loves them but I am not sure this time what to say... You can see in the pictures I added, the toys are not properly polished, but he wooden container broke when I touched it.. it didn’t brake because of the transportation, it’s just such a bad glue. So disappointed! The “orange” looks just like a ball, not a fruit.. don’t waist your money!
customer_reviews.author: Serdienco

customer_reviews.title: Nice Play Pretend Food Set
customer_reviews.text: If you know anything about kids toys you know that melissa and doug products are quality. This food groups play pretend food set is no different. It is a nice quality wood set. I love that not only can the kids pretend cook with this food but that they can also learn some of the food groups too. I deducted a star because the set isn't that old and the paint is already starting to chip which surprised me.
customer_reviews.author: ShopTillYouDrop

customer_reviews.title: STOP!!!!Please don’t buy!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just found my toddler with a mouth full of blue paint chips from the milk carton. Needless to say i screamed and pulled them out and threw the rest of the food items out. Going to check the rest of my Melissa and Doug toys now.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy2717

customer_reviews.title: Cute and adorable!
customer_reviews.text: This set is so cute and adorable. I love the 4 little sturdy wooden boxes to sort all the food into the 4 food groups. The fish is extremely cute and by far my favorite piece. My 16 mo old granddaughter also has a set and loves them, and they withstand her roughness. Very happy with this purchase and would recommend it. The only drawback is that the 2 pieces of bread are sized pretty small, but it doesn't really detract from the whole set.
customer_reviews.author: V.

customer_reviews.title: Great addition
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go along with the Melissa and Doug grocery store toy. These are completely wood and heavy. The have lasted us a long time and even being out in the rain and outside for days on end they haven't lost their color. I don't trust my baby with them because he is a throwing and it hurts when you get hit with them but you know other than that its great.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Great play-kitchen storage!
customer_reviews.text: I discovered Melissa & Doug a few years ago, and I've never been disappointed in their items. I love the more natural approach to children's toys. They also seem to be much more durable than most of the cheap plastic junk available these days. This set is super cute. I mainly bought it so we'd have the sweet little baskets to use as play-kitchen storage. Those kitchens never have enough places to store things and these baskets are perfect for that!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool until the paint starts chipping.
customer_reviews.text: The item is a great teaching tool for food groups, mock cooking, and so on. However, after 2 weeks playing with the item, 2 pieces started peeling, with a 3rd peeling after the 3rd week. When the pieces have intact paint, they're great, but once they start peeling, they just keep shedding paint chips all over the place, which is unsafe. I've considered returning it but because of COVID, I don't have an easy access to a post office, but I'm not sure if I'd recommend this to other parents unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Richard K McKee

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. It's made completely out of wood and the paint is non toxic, so I'm not concerned if the peices get chewed on a bit. Each little crate has food from a different food group, and you can make sandwiches with some of the breads and meats. These are so much better than the plastic for that gets smashed and breaks easily. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah

customer_reviews.title: Just Right and worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 6 year old. I was a little nervous about what they would look like upon arrival. They are a decent size. I would say they are actually perfect of 8 year olds and down in regard to sizing. The crates are adorable. I saw a similar product at Target for $20 and I got these for $12 on here so I'm definitely pleased! I recommended these to my co-worker for her girls! Photo added to show size of food products in an adult hand.
customer_reviews.author: Nieves

customer_reviews.title: Paint chipping off
customer_reviews.text: We bought my daughter this set for Christmas. She loves it! I loved it until after I saw this piece of beef. I don't think she has even played with it yet. The paint is completely coming off. It comes off very easily with just a light scratch of your fingernail. This piece will be going in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Peeling paint
customer_reviews.text: Normally I am a huge fan of Melissa and Doug products but these are not the normal quality. I wiped them down with cleaning wipes and the paint is already peeling off. I use them for preschool so they have to be cleaned and they don't hold up to cleaners so for something like a daycare they don't work well.
customer_reviews.author: Bri J.

customer_reviews.title: Great Food Toys!
customer_reviews.text: These are great as you can expect from Melissa and Doug! We got these to accompany a play kitchen and they are so fun! All of the pieces are wood and are really cute! I especially love the wooden crates that can store the food while they are not being played with! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: My kids received this grocery set as a Christmas present and we love them. I love the fact that they’re wooden and don’t squish them when my 3 year old plays with them. I feel like they’re going to hold up for a long time! I’ve bought lots of Melissa and Doug toys and these are just as great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Julie K

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality- came flawed
customer_reviews.text: Against my better judgment I went for this Melissa and Doug okay food rather than other more expensive wood toy brands and again I regret buying this brand. Paint is already flawed on several of the items and they are just very cheaply constructed compared to other brands we have. Probably will return.
customer_reviews.author: Keirstyn Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for fun and learning.
customer_reviews.text: My 3 y.o. Went crazy with these! As soon as they arrived she ran for them. They are nice and smooth and sturdy wood. Each food group comes in its own little basket. I think they could have added some green veggies, the fruit & veggies box brings tomato, onion, lemon, watermelon, banana, orange. Overall great product. Having loads of fun sorting out the food and cooking 😁. Does not take up much space. Would buy again or gift it.
customer_reviews.author: Huezo

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT Analog Kid Entertainment for Hours
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old and 2 year old daughters were entertained for hours with this 21 piece Melissa and Doug set. Perfect analog toys for teaching, playing and family time. Perfect gift for kids! Love that the wooden food came in the cutest wooden crates, for easy toy clean up and storage. Love!
customer_reviews.author: StrongCurvyFit

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our play kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! They go perfect in my toddler's play kitchen and we like the fact that they are wood. The only downside with the wood as my Pitbull is drawn to chewing on them, she's usually not a chewer but there's something about these that she just loves so be careful pet owners! They included a great variety of the food groups and the wood is very solid and they do not feel cheap like the plastic fruit they have at our local museum play kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Serena

customer_reviews.title: Paint peels off,
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my granddaughter and I am extremely disappointed ! The pain is peeling off , I have to throw them away for her safety. I truly expected better quality from Melissa and Doug products.
customer_reviews.author: Rosaura Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Love, love
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love! More than half of our toys are Melissa and Doug branded and these are a perfect addition to our play kitchen. The crates are perfect!! I mainly ordered this set for the crates and meat and dairy accessories, as I far prefer the plastic Melissa and Doug fruits and veggies. They are much larger and more durable but having the extra wooden ones are a bonus. Well worth it!! You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Candace Cagle Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Great Food
customer_reviews.text: These wooden pieces of food are a great toy for a toddler. They're very durable and can definitely withstand the beating a toddler will give them. They're very sturdy and well put together. This can definitely be a great gift idea if you can't think of anything to give a little one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Dodson

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Paint does come off easily. Like other reviewers said. Decided to try myself as my kids are very gently with their toys. Some already came with white paint on them where they dont belong. Love melissa and Doug but not sure about this one. Orange could've looked more like an an orange too rather than just a ball. The one that they can cut with a knife is much preferable.
customer_reviews.author: Macarena

customer_reviews.title: Love this food set!
customer_reviews.text: We just got our toddler a play kitchen and this food set is the perfect addition. I love it because so many other food sets are either cheap plastic that look terrible and are destroyed easily, OR they include things like pretend cookies, candy, etc, which...ok, we do give him cookies once in awhile, but if he's playing, I'd rather encourage healthy food choices. This set has the perfect balance of food groups and includes healthy food, plus it's all sturdy enough to handle being played with by an active toddler. Our son loves the variety!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect wooden food set!
customer_reviews.text: We are huge fans of Melissa and Doug toys in our home. Our kids have the best time with them and we love how durable they hold up. This set of wooden food is absolutely adorable and great quality. I can’t tell you how many plastic kitchen accessories we’ve gone through because they don’t hold up as well. These are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Carmichael

customer_reviews.title: The indoor ones are looking practically brand new still and the outdoor ones are still in use- they started to split and fade a bit after 8 months to a year rough use and being subjected to the outdoor elements but still loved by my children (now 5 1/2
customer_reviews.text: I bought these almost 2 years ago for my outdoor play house and another set for the indoor play kitchen. The indoor ones are looking practically brand new still and the outdoor ones are still in use- they started to split and fade a bit after 8 months to a year rough use and being subjected to the outdoor elements but still loved by my children (now 5 1/2, 9 and 11 years old) and the children in my daycare (ages 1-5 years old). Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Dree Batley

customer_reviews.title: Watch for splinters
customer_reviews.text: The food items were nice and sturdy, my concern was with the wood crates they came in some of the edges were not sanded down appropriately. I got a pretty bad splinter upon opening them, chose not to give to my granddaughter when I notices several of the edges were in the same condition.
customer_reviews.author: Hey Girl

customer_reviews.title: Creative and cute, but more for teaching than play cooking
customer_reviews.text: Cute but heavy and a little hard to play with. Beware. The orange and onion and lemon are very heavy and hurt when thrown! Lol! These are all solid wood and my 2 yr old keeps thinking they are balls and nailing us. Ha ha. Cute but not my favorite playfood. Would be great for a play store or for teaching food groups, a little hard to make pretend dishes for
customer_reviews.author: Momma in Montana

customer_reviews.title: My almost 2 year old loves playing with this food ...
customer_reviews.text: My almost 2 year old loves playing with this food. Unlike some of our other Melissa and Doug foods, most of these items are really light. The tomato, orange, lemon and milk are solid and a little heavy though. As my toddler is prone to throwing toys and dropping them mid air this is plus in my book as I'm trying to avoid buying cheap plastic foods.
customer_reviews.author: AshleyTop Contributor: Children's Books

customer_reviews.title: Great for Montessori style learning
customer_reviews.text: I’m trying to follow a bit of a Montessori lifestyle for my 15 month old and this is great. They are made of wood, lightweight, seem durable, for now it’ll be nice just to play with the food, but later it’s a good tool to explain food groups
customer_reviews.author: Samy

customer_reviews.title: Very cute, well made, would recommend! Much better quality than the typical plastic play food sets
customer_reviews.text: The detail on these are great- I bought this for my daughter for Christmas and I can't wait to give them to her! Very cute set, nice size, and I like that these are more educational regarding food groups as opposed to the other cheap looking play foods that end up being foods that I wouldn't necessarily encourage my child to eat. I wanted a set that included basics that were also a healthy balance and this accomplishes that.
customer_reviews.author: Cc

customer_reviews.title: Daughter’s choice
customer_reviews.text: We just bought my daughter an you kitchen for Christmas and we wanted more play food to use with the set. My 4 year old daughter picked this set out herself. She plays with them and seems to like them very much. The items in the pack came just as pictured.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey3589

customer_reviews.title: Really nice
customer_reviews.text: Great little collection of foods. I recommend supervision with small babies (1-3y) these are solid wood..they are painful when getting them chucked at your face haha. They can break a window. Other than that no paint is chipping. They are small enough to fit in a place house kitchen. They work well. I love the crates they come in. Easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Hood

customer_reviews.title: This is a lovely set of food.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for a great price. We opted for the wood material over plastic. These are really lovely; the product is nicely painted and very "real" looking. We purchased this to use with Step2 Best Chef's Kitchen, and it is a great addition. Our grandchildren serve us all kinds of delicious meals:) Our grandchildren are 2 years old, and they really enjoy this set.
customer_reviews.author: DPT

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Bought these when I saw a sale go up for them. They are the perfect addition to my kids little pretend store on their shelves. Love the little trays but they are fragile because I just dropped one on accident and the little slats just popped right off. Difficult to even super glue back too... So far the wood food seems to be holding up well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 1/4 crates arrived broken, some paint already chipped
customer_reviews.text: One crate in the mix arrived broken. We glued the pieces back together. Also, several pieces already had minor paint chips. The slices of bread are "meh." They painted the edges but the rest of the bread is just plain wood--I almost tossed them out because I thought they were part of the packaging to help keep the other pieces from shifting too much during shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Tay D

customer_reviews.title: Great for entertaining children!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our exercise rehab office to entertain our patients' children. Boy, has it worked! Today we had three little girls (sisters, aged 5-7) who couldn't wait to tell me all about the meals they had planned and what went with what. This has become the hit of our office with the little ones. This is very helpful to the staff as it keeps the kids occupied while their parents receive treatment. Both genders seem to love these little treats!
customer_reviews.author: Reggierae

customer_reviews.title: so far the crates are fine too. Only complaint is that some of the ...
customer_reviews.text: The food is completely indestructible, so far the crates are fine too. Only complaint is that some of the items are hard to identify as food. The bread is just a tan slab of wood, the orange a plain orange ball etc. Just not as realistic as I'd hoped. Our grandson had to ask what things were not that that stopped him from playing with it and enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: maxiff

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but be careful!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the smaller scale of these food items, as well as the simple design and good quality I've come to expect from Melissa & Doug products. However, because they are wood, I wasn't completely crazy about the cue ball-like orange (or as my husband referred to it -- the window breaker). The tomato and chicken leg also have some heft to them, which could easily hurt a child, wall, window or anything else breakable, especially if your kids are a little wild! But generally speaking my kids (2 yr old triplets) have really liked the food items. And I have to admit I thought the two little bread slices in natural wood were adorable!
customer_reviews.author: tripletmomma

customer_reviews.title: Girls loved it but be cautious
customer_reviews.text: Both my niece and my daughter have this set and love it! Only issues are both times it shipped at least one of the wooden crates was broken. Which is ok, we just threw it out. Also, I will no longer let them play with the wooden crates the food is kept in because one flaked on the bottom of it, we had no idea and my daughter nearly choked on the piece. The food pieces are good so far though.
customer_reviews.author: Kowalls

customer_reviews.title: Great Product but the crates are fragile
customer_reviews.text: We love the quality of M & D products. This item was shipped with multiple items and one of the crates broke during shipping. It was replaced with no issue and when packaged separately arrived without any damage. Only wish the wood wasn't as flimsy for the crates but other than that the food items are perfect and I still love it.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Need some more
customer_reviews.text: Melissa and Doug products have always been a great gifting idea with us. These are lovely, great quality. Have to repurchase them but only because our little one left them out for the dog to chew -__- definitely not chew proof haha but that’s our bad. I’m sure these will last a long time or loving in our kids kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew alex olivares

customer_reviews.title: Adorable toys for imaginative and creative play
customer_reviews.text: Melissa and Doug have quickly become one of my favorite brands for children’s toys. I love the quality of the workmanship and I really love that they steer clear of using plastics. My son got these for Christmas and so far he has really loved them. He really gets to use his imagination and creativity. They are very simply designed but super cute. I love the little crates that they came in too. Can’t wait to purchase more products from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Matney

customer_reviews.title: Food group learning!
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter thinks her little kitchen is the best and these food groups just added to her fun play! She got them for Xmas and I hope she enjoys many years of using them. They are well made and a good learning tool.
customer_reviews.author: Newman

customer_reviews.title: 2 y/o plays chef
customer_reviews.text: My 2 y/o grandson daughter has been exploring with kitchen activities and wanted her own kitchen. She got one for Christmas. We also celebrate the 12 days of Christmas. The 4 crates of wooden food were 4 of her 12 days gifts. She lived owning them and playing with them. They go well with her new kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Lavender Ware

customer_reviews.title: ... loves this and I am sure it will be fun to play with for years to come
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old daughter loves this and I am sure it will be fun to play with for years to come. I think it will also be great to use to teach her the food groups when she gets older. She has been playing with this set for a few weeks and we have only had problems with the Steak piece chipping and it arrived that way. The only thing is that I wish the the food pieces were a little larger. I bought it to go with her Melissa and Doug grocery cart and the pieces fall through the holes. This is why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer G. Ellise

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Play Food
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality play groceries, just as you’d expect from Melissa and Doug. Be forewarned, if you have a toddler who occasionally likes to throw, these are solid wood pieces and could probably do some damage. Especially the round fruits that look like balls to the toddler. Can’t blame him, but I should’ve anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: ELD

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and ok.
customer_reviews.text: Why not use the stuff your real grocery containers? The Mack n cheese box taped up after emptying, the box the butter came in -washed if it’s a tub, microwave. Dinner containers... the kids like these better.
customer_reviews.author: Essie Lea

customer_reviews.title: Such a cute set
customer_reviews.text: These are so cute. I got this as part of my daughters Christmas gift. The little wood boxes are so cute and will be a perfect accessory for her kitchen. The little fruits and vegetables and meats are really cute. Can't wait for her to play with them.
customer_reviews.author: R T B

customer_reviews.title: Melissa & Doug never disappoint
customer_reviews.text: absolutely wonderful is all i can say about this. the size is great and fits well for kid size kitchens and cookware. I really like the Melissa & Doug toys and this is no exception. My chief concern prior to receiving it was if it would be too big for my granddaughter to use with her little cookware and its not a problem. I will be ordering more. It's not directly related to this item, but the puzzles by M&D seem a bit pricey, but they are fantastic as well. they hold up well and they paint doesn't chip even after lots of hard use by a two year old. I would recommend ANY and ALL M & D toys.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Mason

customer_reviews.title: Large variety of food- Kid love it
customer_reviews.text: lOVE Doug and Melissa, great toys for kids, keeping it simple. Kids can go shopping or play restaurant while learning the food groups and different types of food. Good variety. I will continue to buy Melissa and Doug toys.
customer_reviews.author: sl

customer_reviews.title: Great, but smell...
customer_reviews.text: We love Melissa & Doug and these are adorable! My toddler LOVES them! I deducted one star because the little wooden crates the foods are in have a fairly strong, weird smell. Hopefully it’ll go away with time.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Safe wooden toys
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wants her daughter not to teeth on plastic full of chemicals, so this was the perfect gift for her kitchen. She loves the varies size pieces and colors. This will grow with her as she begins actually playing in her kitchen making food.
customer_reviews.author: Khaganh

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this EXCEPT FOR...
customer_reviews.text: Omg this is the cutest set ever! It is smaller than I had thought it'd be. Only thing I don't like is my son will occasionally put things in his mouth and the 2 slices of toast aren't painted or treated with anything like the other foods. So I worry if he puts it in his mouth at all it can/will easily splinter. Otherwise, excellent product, but I totally think they need to do something about the toast.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: So cute!
customer_reviews.text: I love these wooden food items. I have even found some use for the little crates they are packaged in. My only complaint is that the Orange does not look like an orange to a young toddler...it just looks like a ball. HAHA The orange is put away for now, but he loves playing with everything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Averagely good
customer_reviews.text: This product is made of real wood. I love those 4boxes they are really cute. However, some of the items in it are not crafted or painted well to be identified as what it is suppose to. Like a tomato, it just looked like an orange ball. However, the product is sturdy, paint does not chip or fades. My daughter has it for a year now and still likes to play it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Kelsey Paddayuman

customer_reviews.title: Arrived a little broken but nothing I was mad about. Overall love this item
customer_reviews.text: My 9.5 month old chews it a bit but no paint or warping has happened to any of the items. I love how pretty it is and timeless. PERFECT! I gave it a 4 star because two of the pieces arrived broken on the boxes. Luckily I have some soft wood glue. Doesn’t effect the sturdiness but still. It was broken.
customer_reviews.author: Ivonne Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Wooden toys wrapped in tons of plastic packaging.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful wooden toys. But disappointed the full set and each of the four food groups was wrapped in individual plastic packaging. I wish Melissa and Doug could find a way to ship without all of the plastic. Making such thoughtful toys for kids shows they care about childhood development and the future, maybe they can find a way to improve their packaging methods to also be future focused. (PlanToys was able to figure it out..)
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: I love this company's products. Everything is well made and durable. This was a gift for my 2yr old and she loved it. She likes to "cook" for me and she loves having more variety in her toys.
customer_reviews.author: Marinda

customer_reviews.title: Inspect it good.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely was excited to have the wooden food for the girls to play with. I opene the package and the hamburger was split. I don’t want to go through the hustle of packing everything up just for the one piece of the package being damaged. It’s weird cause the product was wrapped very well. It’s odd that the hamburger piece was broken.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Steed

customer_reviews.title: Great for play kitchen, just inspect all pieces.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, these are great. My only complaint is that one of the pieces showed up damaged. The orange has paint like chipping off so I was sure not to give it to my daughter. No other items are chipping or look damaged
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: I was so impressed with this! We got food for my little boy’s kitchen but it came with a lot of cardboard items that he tore up so we ordered this and it’s wooden pieces so it’s super durable and great quality! I love this brand in general.
customer_reviews.author: TROY

customer_reviews.title: A must have for any play kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: The Melissa & Doug food groups set is a must have for any play kitchen! My children have this set and I recently purchased it again for a gift. I love how the food groups are simply broken down for an easy lesson on food groups and nutritional needs. The food items are wooden and of a great quality. They are very durable and have held up to lots of use. The colors are vibrant and also hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Fam5tn

customer_reviews.title: Small and Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: The food pieces are small, but perfect for a toddler. They are sturdy and aren't full of plastic grossness (official term, obviously). There was some paint here and there from knocking against each other, but this doesn't bother anyone. I love that you can "make" the burger, and would like the ability to do it with the hot dog bun/hot dog as well, but that's my only complaint. The pieces are definitely small, so don't be expecting anything big. My 1 year old has a small grocery cart, and all the pieces together take up less than half of the cart. Great quality though, and would order again.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Durable toys
customer_reviews.text: Just great for children who are not aggressive. It can hurt someone if they are thrown.
customer_reviews.author: David N. Perez

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I was super hesitant after I bought this if I would actually like it. I saw a ton of reviews that had me worried, but I'm glad I did!! I will say, the baskets are smaller than what I thought they would be... but it actually worked great in her little fridge and made it looked organized! Plus, the food is adorable. I cant really say how durable it is because we just received, but super cute!
customer_reviews.author: KaylaFrizzell

customer_reviews.title: Pre-School Quality Toy/Learning Tool!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the cutest little high quality kitchen/homemaker set! The pieces are made of solid wood (so do supervise the play of your little ones). I intend to teach my toddler granddaughter to sort by colors, shapes, food groups etc. The tiny crates are adorable and make for easy clean up and storage! Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and in good condition. I see it getting scratched up and chipped very easily with my rough and tumble boy, but it will also withstand his type of play better than any cardboard option or other options with paper labels. It’s a great hands on way to learn about different foods and the different food groups.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: My toddler (and her friends!) love this wooden play food! The crate sides could stand to be slightly more durable, however. The very first time my daughter played with it, one of the slats broke off, but it is easy enough to glue back on. The food is attractively colored and we're happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Profplaydoe

customer_reviews.title: Cute toys
customer_reviews.text: Great product but the wooden cartons the food comes in break easy. The toddler that this was purchased for happens to fall down on the wooden crate and snap it. It left splinters on the sides of the wood slats so it had to be thrown away.
customer_reviews.author: Keri E.

customer_reviews.title: Small but nice
customer_reviews.text: It’s a bit smaller than expected but my my son and his friends love it. I should have read the dimensions of the crates the food comes in. I added a picture to compare it with my hand. I have small hands so keep that in mind. I do like that these are wooden instead of plastic so that’s a plus.
customer_reviews.author: JBMTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Toy
customer_reviews.text: I love the quality of the wooden play food! They have produced my children with hours of fun and make the perfect to any imaginative play. It’s also a helpful tool in toddler language development as they name and identify the different foods and sort them into food groups or by colors. Have outlasted any plastic set we have previously owned. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slippery wooden chipped pieces that are easily dropped, splittered and chipped
customer_reviews.text: Slippery wooden chipped pieces that are easily dropped, splittered and chipped. M&D has definitely lowered some standards within past year.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie Auggie

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I just LOVE Melissa & Doug toys. They really are so well made. Another great toy. Other food we have gotten the butter, milk, etc is boxes and get ruined fast. These are wood and will last
customer_reviews.author: ed

customer_reviews.title: Play food looks great, broken wooden box but otherwise great set.
customer_reviews.text: Just received this product and went to set it out for my son. The food seems to be well made and a great size for little hands. The wooden boxes they come in are not well made. The one box came to my door broken. So cute idea for the boxes but the one is already broken before my kiddo has even played with them. But otherwise a very cute play food set.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Durfee

customer_reviews.title: Great set for kids
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my niece, she absolutely loves it. She also got a kitchen set for Christmas but the plastic food always gets chewed up or destroyed. These are perfect for her.
customer_reviews.author: Softball Mom

customer_reviews.title: I’ve never been disappointed with Melissa and Doug products
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never been disappointed with Melissa and Doug products. Always long lasting and enduring. I am a speech therapist and ordered these, kept them unopened and away from kids for a specific lesson I’d planned. I opened them this morning as I prepared for my lesson to find a scratched item (which I expected to happen AFTER it’s been played by with children) and a cracked butter that will break off if a kiddo plays with it long enough. Quite disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Melissa & Doug Food Groups
feature_bullets: Healthy pretend play: Melissa & doug food groups wooden play food is a sturdy wooden food set that features items from the 5 food groups for healthy pretend play; it includes watermelon, milk, cheese, fish, eggs, and more

Fun and educational: This play food for kids set helps children plan a well balanced meal; It helps introduce the basics of nutrition, and can be used to teach early number skills, color recognition, sorting, and grouping

Easy to store: 4 wooden crates are included to sort the food into groups dairy, produce (for fruits and vegetables), grains, and meat and fish; Kids can also sort by color or use the crates to combine foods to serve up pretend play meals
Great gift for ages 3 and up: The Food Groups Wooden Play Food set makes a great gift for kids ages 3 to 6; The Melissa & Doug Play Time Produce and Vegetables Play Food set is a great accompaniment

The gold standard in childhood play: for more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that nbc news called “the gold standard in early childhood play.”

100 percent happiness guarantee: We design every toy to the highest quality standards, and to nurture minds and hearts; if your child is not inspired, give us a call and we'll make it right; our phone number is on every product
